SEARCH

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Inventory class that manages the items in the game. The class uses an EnumMap to store the count of each item type.

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      Default constructor for the Inventory class. Initializes the items map.

    • Inventory

      public Inventory(int countApples, int countBanana, int countPurple, int countGreen)
      Constructor for the Inventory class.

      Initializes an items map with the specified counts for each item.
      Parameters:
      countApples - The initial count of apples.
      countBanana - The initial count of bananas.
      countPurple - The initial count of purple gifts.
      countGreen - The initial count of green gifts.

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Item item)
      Adds one count of the specified item to the inventory.

      If an item is not already in the inventory, it is added with a count of 1. If it is already in the inventory, its count is incremented by 1.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to add to the inventory.

    • getCount

      public int getCount(Item item)
      Returns the count of a specified item in the inventory, if there is any.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to get the count for.
      Returns:
      The count of the specified item in the inventory.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(Item item)
      Removes one count of the specified item from the inventory.

      If the item is in the inventory and its count is greater than 1, its count is decremented by 1. If the count is 1, the item is removed from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to remove from the inventory.

    • getInventory

      public EnumMap<Item,Integer> getInventory()
